conclusion: It isn’t possible to compute travel-time without knowing the vertical distance from O to AB.
The angle of refraction r is calculated using Snell's law: r = 30 degrees.
Inside the block, the speed of light is v = c/sqrt(2).
The vertical component of velocity vy is calculated as vy = c/(2sqrt(2)).
The flight-time from O to AB is t = (2sqrt(2) * Δy) / c.
Knowing the vertical distance Δy allows calculation of numerical time.
